Reviews.Title: “Great location! The rest is basic.”
Reviews.Author: Anthonyaf
Reviews.Content: + hotel is located at the very heart of saint Germaine. 2 min away from the metro and surrounded by restaurants and cafes. + friendly staff + clean - rooms are very small and stuffy,as air condition was not working and the heating could not be controlled. - Our room was facing the street which was quite noisy, so if u are a light sleeper this hotel is not for you. - expensive - renovations going on at the moment - if you have a pushchair, be prepared to leave it in the lobby because the lift is too small and the upstairs landing and room are too narrow to manoevre it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: batey29
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 standard rooms for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. Rooms were small but adequate for our needs. Hotel very clean and staff helpful. They were having the stairs re decorated at the time but they did e mail is about this and it made no difference to our stay. The location is great, easy to walk to many sights from there, and we walked there with luggage from Gare Du Nord as it was a very sunny day on our arrival. Lots of places to eat nearby too. We had rooms at the back so weren't affected by the noise from the street. The only "negative" is that the hotel breakfast, although nice, was expensive at 14 euros each. We got a brakfast for 4 of us at almost half the price arond the corner at the Atlas cafe.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: efrat1972
Reviews.Content: a very nice hotel, welcoming stuff, clean, perfect location. we booked large room with view to the street the room was very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Left Bank Location”
Reviews.Author: bking222
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Regent is a small boutique hotel, with very helpful staff, located beautifully two blocks from the Seine. Great local restaurants, shops and street stands just outside the door. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LATraveler1727
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here. It's in the midst of the St. Germain area: near the boulevard, just off the Rue de Buci open marketplace, easy walk to the river. We got a pretty room, spacious and airy, with 2 twins that you could push together to form a king bed. Wanted a street view, made sure we wouldn't be looking out on a roof or shaft. Everything was super clean, which is very important to me. Staff was pleasant and helpful, breakfast was the usual delicious baguette and croissant with coffee. Best thing is the location -- you can walk almost anywhere, and it's near the Metro if you need to go far. Hundreds of restaurants and cafes to walk to. We've recommended it to friends and we'd definitely stay here again. The 6th is our favorite area and this is the perfect base to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Some great, some bad...”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: Ok, well I will premise my feedback with my scenario: I am an American who travelled to Paris for the first time with my wife. We got a Deluxe room (#42) for 7 nights and primarily chose Le Regent because of the stellar feedback on Tripadvisor. It was a great trip but we only used the hotel to sleep in since we were out being tourists all day and evening. With that said, 235 euros a night is a bit pricey for using it maybe 9 or 10 hours of the day. The staff was wonderful, spoke good English and entertained our poor French. They made suggestions and asked us for our feedback on activities we did. Room was very clean and made nicely each day. I would say the location is pretty good like most reviews. The metro was close (we usually walked to the St Michel station since the walk was nice and there are more trains out of that station over Odeon which may be a little closer). I would also add, since this was one of my big questions, is that I always felt safe in and around the neighborhood. The main CON is that we had a street side room (by choice) that looked out on Rue Dauphine which was a very great view BUT the street noise was terrible. I woke up each night to something, whether it was people yelling or trash trucks and even 6AM construction of some sort a couple buildings down. The windows in our room were not very soundproof. I literally listened to a conversation on the street one night while i laid in bed with the windows shut. And we were on the 5th floor! And i dont have some sort of bionic super strong hearing! I ended up playing music on my iPod and going back to sleep. This didn't ruin my stay, but it is a little disconcerting that I pay $300+ (american dollars) a night in a great neighborhood and have trouble sleeping because of noise. **I will say that I did not bring this issue up with the hotel, because the hotel was close to full, we were already settled, and we didn't want to be those Americans that complained about everything! My advice to anyone in my situation or close to it, evaluate how much time you want to spend in a hotel. There are cheaper options that are either not as extravagant or further away. If a hotel is just a room to sleep in and take a shower, like it was for us, we would probably stayed somewhere else or have chosen the smaller room. The metro is highly reliable and useful, but it is nice to be close and be able to walk places instead. But on the flip side, if you aren't on a tight budget, Le Regent is almost flawless, maybe ask for an interior room, or ask about street noise feedback in the room you are in.

Reviews.Title: “Bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: RannTel-Aviv
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in October 2011, based on positive reviews read here. Unfortunately, the hotel did not live up to expectations in all fields. After previously having stayed at centrally located hotels in big cities, I decided to book a (standard) double room even though I was travelling on my own. This was done to avoid being given a very small cell-like room (something which I have experienced more than once). Nevertheless, the room allotted to me at the Regent Hotel was definitely the smallest I have ever had. Although it was fully equipped with all necessary amenities, there was virtually no room to stand up in. Even worse, the toilet was almost impossible to sit on as it was positioned very closely to the opposite wall. Knees and forehead actually touched this wall when using the toilet (I am of average height, if you are wondering). Having said this, the hotel is well appointed, clean, about a two minute walk from the Odeon Metro station and in the middle of the Saint Germain / Latin Quarter area, giving easy access to Paris' attractions and being situated in a main nightlife area (the later causing a bit of street noise at night, especially since the hotel faces a rather main street). The staff was very helpful and spoke fluent English. Since the Metro system in Paris is extremely efficient, I would opt for a higher notch hotel away from the centre of town which could be booked for a similar price (I paid 144 Euros per night at the Regent for a standard double room. A continental breakfast is an additional 14 Euros and a full English one 18. There are many dining options in the hotel's immediate area for less). All in all, and judging by other reviews, if you do decide to stay at this hotel, book a Superior Deluxe room and not a standard double, although in my opinion, it is way overpriced in any case.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: Constance W
Reviews.Content: My husband, sister-in-law and I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Le Regent recently. The location was excellent - just a short walk to The Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, Notre Dame, and tour cruises on the Seine. There were lots of excellent cafes around the hotel, so we never had any trouble finding something good to eat. The room was very clean, and was a decent size. We reserved a Superior Deluxe room so we could all share one room. It was a little tight with the extra bed in there, but was bigger than we expected it would be. The bathroom was a nice size, and the shower had great water pressure, which was nice after long days of sightseeing. Our room overlooked the street, and there was some noise from the cafes, but it was not bad, although our visit was during the week, so I don't know if it would have been a problem on the weekend. The hotel staff were all extremely helpful, particularly Elias. He gave us perfect directions for getting to several sights, including the Seine cruise, and a trip to Versailles, and provided recommendations for other things to see and places to eat. The price seemed comparable to other hotels that I looked at, and the great location makes it an even better value. The only negatives were the very small elevator (luckily we were on the 2nd floor, so only had to use the elevator for our arrival and departure when we had our luggage) and the slowness of the internet connection. We would definitely stay here again for a future visit, and have recommended the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: cranapple5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of Saint Germain. Nearby metro stations are Saint Germain and Odeon. Lots of CafÃ©, Brasseries, fine restaurants, bakeries, cheese shops, chocolate shops, banks, exchange places, all within walking distance. Loved sitting at a cafÃ© and do people-watching (very fashionable people) over a glass of wine. Louvre, Notre Dame, Saint-Germain, all nearby. Free Wi-Fi. The staff spoke very good English, yet appreciated your effort to talk a little in French. I felt welcomed. I could not ask more for a hotel, and next time I got to Paris I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Skip”
Reviews.Author: Amir_Rozenberg
Reviews.Content: If you're out of options or considering sleeping on the street. - First time when I arrived very late after a full day, the clerk new my name, which was great and worrying. Apparently someone decided to extend their stay, the hotel was otherwise booked, so gracefully they punted me to another hotel. The clerk gave such directions that I spent spying the streets for the other hotel for the next hour. Around midnight he agreed to finally show me where that was. Of course, I had to pack and return the next day. - When I arrived, I found a very small room (typical to this area), inhuman work desk and split single beds. No biggie. With the exception that I needed to work. The hotel says there is wifi. There certainly is wifi router, but the connection is...say dial-up speed? and disconnects every minute. In short, if you want to connect to the web, this is not the place for you. - From the 3rd floor, you can hear people whispering in the street, it's insane. This is a touristy area that doesn't quiet down ever. If you want to get some sleep into you, this is not it. The good news is the location, it is in the heart of a restaurant/bar area. Fun for people who don't need rest. Of course, other than the night clerk expressing regrets, there is no compensation or anything to make you feel better. They could not care less.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Grantminnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family in two rooms. Both were lovely,spotlessly clean and just plain nice. The people at the front desk are patient, most pleasant, and extremely helpful, whether with directions or reservations. The neighborhood is handy (walking distance to Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Dorsey, the Pantheon and more.We couldn't have been more pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, small, friendly & clean; reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: 30POP
Reviews.Content: On the Left Bank, we had the deluxe superior room on the 5th floor. Spacious for a Paris 3 star hotel. Staff speaks English and is very accommodating. ATM just outside the hotel and lots of great restaurants nearby. Continental breakfast in the basement "cave" nicely done. Free wifi. Room nicely decorated. Bathroom was spacious and modern. Room was quiet and had a view of rooftops and Rue Dauphine below. Double glazing in the windows kept the street noise out. We'll stay here again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FMCJC
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was ideal for visiting the Latin Quarter and St. Germain des PrÃ©s area. You walk down Dauphine Street and you are by the Seine and on the Pont Neuf! Also 5 minutes to the metro Odeon. Lots of restaurants, gelato shop, fruit market, bookstore, flower shop, delicatessen across the street on Rue de Buci, a very lively area. On the way to the metro we always had our breakfast at Eric Kayserâ€™s bakery shop (across from the Procope CafÃ©). Superb! The air conditioned rooms were always very clean (the bed was comfortable too) and the bathroom is very nice; the shower/bath combo has a glass panel that lets the water leak onto the floor, so we just wiped it with the floor mat. We got the larger room and it was fine. They are in the process of renovating other rooms, so they actually upgraded our room because the one we requested was under construction. The staff was always helpful and courteous and spoke very good English. I will return to this hotel again also because the location is so enjoyable. On the corner of Rue Mazarine there were always artists singing or playing at night surrounded by small crowds. What fun! Interestingly enough, we could not hear any noise in our rooms at night coming from the street. Definitely highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: P_and_P_50s
Reviews.Content: Reception staff extremely helpful, and spoke good English. Our room (no.1 on ground floor) was recently refurbished and amazing with large, impressive bathroom. Excellent breakfast (costs extra) served either in room or breakfast room. Problem with mini bar fridge was dealt with promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: judym698
Reviews.Content: Everyone has already mentioned the fabulous location which is why I chose this hotel. We walked just about everywhere. I had read on TA that the rooms in Paris are generally small so I reserved a superior deluxe double for our four night stay knowing we would each have a large suitcase. Our room, #22, was still kinda small so I wonder what you need to request in order to get the "large" rooms that have been mentioned here. Did not have the opportunity to see other rooms so I don't know how ours would compare. The solution is to leave half your clothes at home and bring smaller luggage!! The room was very attractive and faced the front as I wanted a view of life on the street. I would not be happy with a view of a wall even if the room is quieter at night! The double glazed windows were great for keeping the noise down while sleeping and I loved opening them in the morning and seeing the window boxes filled with red geraniums...a scene right out of the picture books! Our bathroom was very large, clean, and modern. The shower/tub combo had a glass panel that only enclosed it part way so water would leak out onto the floor every time you showered...we soaked it up with the bath mat and a new one was given each day. There was some construction taking place on our floor which started pretty early and woke us up one morning. The other mornings we heard it but were already up and getting ready to leave for a day of sightseeing so it did not really annoy us. It's nice to know that they are updating the property for future guests... the lovely lobby area is evidence of that!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location small and personal”
Reviews.Author: jubilee107
Reviews.Content: Rooms small but tastefully decorated and contained all you need. Very much french style. Front staff were very helpful Tony n Val from Oz

Reviews.Title: “Decent Accomodation for the Price”
Reviews.Author: tourismento
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for value for money, this is the place for you. It recently added new laundry facilities and additional space for dining. Included breakfast package was good. Rooms were equipped with hair dryers, a sink and the bath towels. However, rooms were a tad too small for my liking, and if you do get a room facing the main road, the noise from traffic could disrupt your sleep if one is a light sleeper. Altogether, a pleasant stay for 5 nights,

Reviews.Title: “Great location - we'd return!!”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTraveller123
Reviews.Content: We'd stayed at the hotel for 8 nights in the Superior Deluxe room. Plenty of room for two - bathroom a nice size as well. The room was very clean. The only negative that we would have is that the room had 2 twin beds put together to make a double. We could hear the cars (in the background) when it was busy but it wasn't a problem for us. Location excellent - we walked to everything (Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triomphe, Louvre,etc). Many, many bistro, cafes, bakeries in the hotel area. The only bus we took was to Monmartre. The Staff was a great help with taxi, restaurant suggestions, etc. We'd return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: pipslon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and were very pleased. Everything was spotlessly clean. We were in a deluxe room which was quite small but the bathroom was a good size. We were on the street side so it was a little noisy but had a very sweet balcony. All the staff we met were very friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic for all the things going on in St. Germain. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful experience.”
Reviews.Author: singpon
Reviews.Content: What a charming boutique hotel,in the heart of Saint Germain, close the city main attractions. The bedroom and bathroom are massive and very very comfortable. There are many restaurants and cafe nearby. What I really like what this hotel is that is very cozy!!!

Reviews.Title: “the ultimate charming parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: grayslakegirl
Reviews.Content: this is my second stay with hotel le regent and i wanted to add my review to the other positive ones on trip advisor. I love this hotel for several reasons; it is near everything in Paris that you need to see (steps to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Cluny, Seine riverboats, etc.),it is just across from the wonderfully French Rue de Bucy market so you can grab fruit and cheese, and the restaurants, creperies and boulangeries around every corner are wonderful. Rue St. Andre des Arts, at the corner, is a medieval walking street with fascinating history. Sandrine and Angelique made everything so easy for us by calling cabs when needed and graciously parking my daughter's wheelchair in their beautiful lobby. The rooms have the tall, tall ceilings of a 17th century mansion and are stunningly decorated -- ask for the rooms that look out onto Rue Dauphine and the busy streets below, where window boxes filled with flowers frame your view. Bathrooms have lovely marble and are antiseptically clean. If I had a complaint about this hotel it would be only one.....i had to leave it!

Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JarthurKent
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the hotel and it was as good as last time. OK the rooms are small (but so were all the other rooms we have stayed in in Paris - some smaller than this one!) Location is 500 metres from the metro Odeon on the Bld. St Germain with plenty of restaurants of all types and sizes catering for all budgets and bars nearby (but no noise of these in the hotel). Also close to the centre of Paris (Ile de la City / Notre Dame) Staff very friendly (speak good english), but we avoided the breakfast, prefering the cheaper Cafe Danton on the Bde St Germain right beside the Odeon Metro. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “VERY friendly to travelers (read if you need help planning a Paris trip)”
Reviews.Author: zenchief
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Regent for New Years, and completely recommend it for people like me (who do not speak French) but want a friendly hotel in hipster neighborhood. The Hotel: the staff is the main reason you come, everyone was painfully friendly...EXCEPT for one guy, on one night, who worked the overnight shift. That guy was a stereotypical, little French snob...but honestly my wife and I laughed at it for days after. The front desk helped us confirm and make reservations, also provided suggests for local restaurants and tours. The Neighborhood: the Latin qtr reminds me of Soho or the East Village, very hip, LOTS of restaurants, bars, nightlife. Naturally because of this the area is a bit crowded, but given it's proximity to Metro and famous monuments, I guess it's not unexpected. The St. Michael Metro stop was our main source of transportation, connects quickly across central Paris for all major monuments. Getting to and from the airport: I used PariShuttle (http://www.parishuttle.com) getting to the hotel, was very quick and easy (call an 800 number off the plane for pick up). On the way back to the airport, I used a service suggested by the front desk...not a good idea. Once to the airport, they threw in extra surcharges and threatened to drop us off at the wrong terminal Bottomline: great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, small room”
Reviews.Author: PeteL92833
Reviews.Content: Location is handy to many shops and restaurants, plus Notre Dame, the Louvre and Musee d'Orsay. Hotel website photos makes property look a lot fancier than it was in our room #61. Hard to believe in this day and age that they do not have an internet terminal available. Rooms OK for one person, very tight for two unless they have very little luggage. Starbucks around corner much better value for breakfast than their charge of 14 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, smallish room”
Reviews.Author: msu_mom
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel. There were lots of restaurants nearby and we could walk to many sites. The metro station was a short walk away. A few doors down there was a little place to buy crepes, sandwiches, and drinks that was open at all hours. The area was very lively. We paid 230 euros a night for a small room but that is typical for Paris. The bathroom was very nice but the glass half shower door wasn't properly sealed on the corner causing water to leak onto the floor. Towels were large and fluffy. Staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! High recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: ttjv2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of September 2010 for 3 nights after a 5 night stay at Le Bristol (a very high-end swanky hotel in the 8th). I have to say that I preferred Le Regent much more than our first hotel. The staff was excellent and helpful (esp. the night watch). The room (a superior room on the 6th floor) was more spacious than I anticipated and the decor was very lovely. The bathroom was large enough and clean. Our room faced right onto rue Dauphine and there was some construction during the day but we sleep perfectly at night, even with the lively streets below. The bed (two twins pushed together and made with one sheet- the size of a king) was incredibly comfortable as was the cozy duvet. The bar fridge was perfect for storing water and snacks. The television was small- but we weren't in Paris to watch t.v! The price (230 Euros/night) was very reasonable, esp. in this area of Paris. Great value for our money! The location of this hotel is ideal. I stayed by myself for the first day and a half and felt very comfortable walking around, finding good places to eat (and shop!). You can turn around any corner and find another amazing street. I walked about 6 hours every day just exploring Paris and soaking it all in. The hotel is walking distance to many destinations (Sorbonne, rue Mouffetarde, Luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame and Ste-Chapelle, Marais district, Louvre, Seine- even the Eiffel Tower is only about a 30 minute walk). It's close to the Metro which is incredibly easy to use. It was so hard to come home! We'll be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Location, and Room”
Reviews.Author: rhinette
Reviews.Content: Sandrine, Albert, and all the staff were wonderful. They helped make our stay in Paris so enjoyable and made us feel very welcome. The hotel location is perfect for sightseeing and eating, and our "Luxury Superior" room (#11) was pretty and comfortable. The neighborhood can get boisterous at night; but sleeping was not a problem. The air conditioning was appreciated because we were in Paris when the temps were in the upper 80s. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service - Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: trailrider15
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at Le Regent was in Sept. 07. We had a lovey room on the second floor overlooking the square, which is everything that is quintessentially Paris. This review is to inform readers of the "extra mile" that the hotel staff went to on our behalf. We went to Bordeaux from Paris. That afternoon in our hotel room in Bordeaux I noticed that I was missing my very expensive gold chain bracelet. Feeling distraught we retraced our steps looking for the bracelet. Back in our hotel room in Bordeaux an email from Le Regent informed us that they had found a valuable piece of jewelry in our room. I am so thankful and appreciative of their honesty and quick response. Needless to say whenever in Paris it is Le Regent for us! Lesson- never take expensive jewellry when travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location -but room tiny!”
Reviews.Author: ImpiSA
Reviews.Content: My husband suprised me with an anniversary trip to Paris- so he landed up booking this hotel with my knowledge. The location was fantastic -easy access to transport, 2 minute walk tot the Seine, and 5 mins away from the Notre Dame; loads of restaurants in the area etc. But the rooms are tiny -initially we were given a stardard room, which literally just fits the double bed (and its a small double) but then we upgraded to a bigger room (it was an extra 40 euros per night). It was quite expensive compared to other european cities I have travelled to, but I expect that is the price for being in Paris, in a good location. Don't have the hotel breakfast -there are great bakeries all around, and a supermarket not even 2 minutes away....and treat yourself to a delicious crepe!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: melssNewYork
Reviews.Content: My first time in Paris, we wanted a small boutique hotel in the St. Germaine district. The location of Le Regent was so perfect. We could walk everywhere (to all of the tourist sites, museums and major shopping areas). The streets around the hotel were chock full of little shops, galleries and cafes. It was lovely. There was a metro station (and a Starbucks) close by so we were happy. We had everything that we needed. The front desk staff were wonderfully pleasant and spoke English. They were able to help us whenever we needed it. Internet access was billed by the hour ($5 Euros) and you had to get a password from the front desk. The lobby and the rooms were very clean. Our room, #16 was on the second floor and was extremely TINY, there was room for only one suitcase on the floor. The bathroom was marble and quite clean, although again very small. Since there were two of us, next time we will get a deluxe room, it would be worth the extra $50 Euros per night. The mini fridge was good to keep water and fresh fruit in, and there was a safe for stowing jewelry and cameras when not being used. The room was totally quiet, no noise at all at night. The location is what amazed me though. We couldn't have been in a better place if we had known what we were doing when we chose this hotel. I plan to go back as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly people in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ss1968
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on it's location which is just superb. It's within an easy walk (even with a bag) of a couple of metro stations, so very easy to get to and from CDG airport. The room was fairly typical of those in Paris (i.e. a little small and an odd shape), but more than adequate for a 3 night stay. Furnishings were comfortable and very clean. Aside from the location, the major positive of Le Regent is the staff. They were, without exception, polite and helpful, patient with my poor spoken French and all fluent in English. Even the night watch (often a weak point) went out of his way to make us feel comfortable. There are dozens of bars and restaurants within a few metres (no problems with noise), so no trouble to find a good meal atany time of day. If you are after a reasonably priced place to saty that is within easy reach of all the major attractions in Paris I would reccomend Le Regent without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: magrant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Regent for 6 nights and we did upgrade to a larger room but still got the internet rate. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. The location is just the best, after walking around Paris for 5 days i do believe we stayed in the best area, we had cafe's and restaurant's right on our door step. We also spent our last two night back in Paris before we flew home, that time we stayed in the Opera area, it was okay but didn't have all the cafe's and restaurants. We would highly recomend Le Regent, and we will stay there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: carcol29
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Paris. I've stayed there twice already....I've also brought collegues of mine to the same hotel. The staff is great and very friendly....very accomodating! The hotel is located in the best neighborhood of St. Germain de Pres....there is so much to do around there....you will find it all....just a few blocks away from Notre Dame and Latin Quarters....right outside the hotel doors are plenty of great restaurants, clubs, bars, supermarkets, cheese shops, bakery, parking lot, galleries, clothing and jewelry shops, plenty of cafes for people watching....There are 2 rooms in the hotel that have small balconies....these rooms are at that standard single room rate so request that room for an added bonus. Great for smokers or just to sit and get fresh air. The rooms are small but has plenty of closet space. There is a great Italian restaurant across the street, a Gelato place just a few steps away and a Crepe place (it's a hole in the wall place that you order from the sidewalk) that you must go to. I love this hotel and will always be my first choice when I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janiegb
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have not only stayed at the Le Regent 7 times during the past 20 years, but have recommended this lovely hotel to many of our friends throughout the years. No one has ever been disappointed. True, the standard double is small by American standards, I can assureyou that many more expensive hotels than this in Paris charge $100.00 more per nite for the same square footage. I speak first hand, as on spur of the moment trip Le Regent was fully booked and we were forced to stay at another hotel in the area. That said, the service at the front desk is outstanding and most helpful, the breakfast delicious, albeit pricey, and the rooms ALWAYS squeaky clean. It says a lot about the hotel when the personnel have been there for years and recognize us upon arrival ! The locaton is the best in the city...close to everything, handy to the wonderful markets and shops just outside the door, but I can assure you that one inside your room, it is totally soundproof and you will not hear a sound. A true gem of a hotel...we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: GermanMum
Reviews.Content: I led a group to Paris during the half-term holidays, and our youth hostel didn't have space for all of us. So we took three rooms at the Regent: one four-bed, one three-bed (with view of Sacre Sucre) and a double. The rooms were clean, and our room, the quad, was the best of all. We had four single beds, and enough room that the girls weren't in each other's way. The best thing about the hotel was the staff. I had had problems with an Eiffel Tower employee in picking up our group tickets, and the very nice young man at the desk let me use the hotel computer to retrieve the information I needed to verify our booking. I will never be able to thank him enough, since, without his help, I would have had 30 unhappy students. The downsides were the confusion about where the rooms were located. There are two lifts, and if you're not careful, you'll wind up in the wrong wing. Breakfast in not included in the room price, which wasn't clear at the booking. The hotel didn't charge me for the kids' meals, but do be careful when you check-in. I would stay here again, since, for the price, you're unlikely to find anything as clean and/or pleasant. I wouldn't recommend it for groups, however.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Beaune
Reviews.Content: I am happy that the air conditioning problem reported in the prior review was addressed in July. During our 4-day stay in August it was quite warm, but the air conditioning worked perfectly by American standards. We were delighted to stay in room 41, a deluxe superior room. This hotel, unlike some others nearby, describes on its website the size of the room. Yes, the regular rooms are smaller, but that is what you ask for when you book them. This deluxe superior room cost 180 euros over the internet and offered great value. Both the bedroom and the bathroom were large by left-bank standards. The bed was comfortable but a little soft for my personal preferences. While smoking is permitted in this hotel, there was no sign of any foul smell. Room 41 has 3 windows overlooking rue Dauphine; even though one of our four nights was a Saturday, there was no noise to complain about on any night. The shower was excellent, with good force and without any annoying change in temperature common in many hotels. There was plenty of shelf and closet space. As others have noted, the hairdryer blows hot but not with much vigor. So if you need something stronger, bring your own. But for me it was OK. And yes, the bedroom floor is a little slanted; so leave your marbles at home. The location epitomizes Paris. There are all types of markets, cafes, bistros, bakeries, gelato (Amorino is to die for), all within a block or so of the hotel. In my opinion, one could not ask for a better location, merely 3 blocks from the Ile de la Cite at the other end of rue Dauphine. While the hotel does offer a breakfast at 14 euros a person, we declined and ate out every morning. We especially liked the Cafe de Paris on rue Buci that offered for 12.50 euros a breakfast of fresh juice, hot coffee or tea, a 3-egg omelet with ham and cheese, and a croissant as well as bread and jam. Just outside the hotel there is an ATM machine. And around the corner there is a super market. Everything one needs is so close and convenient. If one likes classical music, there are frequent evening concerts in Sainte Chapelle. The acoustics are superb and the setting magical. The hotel staff--Henry, Sandrine, and Angelique--are very friendly, efficient, and helpful in giving advice, explaining things, and making reservations. The bottom line is that there is nothing to dislike about this hotel. The elevator is a bit small, but that is about it. For those looking for the perfect place to stay in the charming part of Paris, you have found it. But be sure you look for the Le Regent at 61 rue Dauphine, since there seem to be others in Paris with the same name.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: travel123SanJose
Reviews.Content: Our 3 day stay at Hotel Le Regent was very pleasant. We had the deluxe double room which gave us enough room to move around in. We peaked in a standard room and it was only large enough for the bed. We had enough closet space, two chairs, bedside tables and a writing table. A small refrigerator and TV. The bathroom was on the small side but comfortable and decorated nicely. The location is very good, we walked to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Isle St. Louis, Museum Cunny. We took the red tour bus at the Louvre to get to spots further away. A plus was that their offices are only a block or two away, and we picked up the tour bus there for an evening tour and night at the Moulin Rouge. We never needed a taxi nor the metro. Restaurants abound, so no problem there. However, 2 out of the 3 nights were noisy from restaurants on the street and their boisterous patrons. But you're in a big city, so I wasn't surprised. One minor problem was the wireless internet signal didn't work, but we were refunded our money. Next day we went to the Starbucks around the corner and used their wireless. My husband and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL CLOSE TO NOTRE DAME”
Reviews.Author: ROAMING9
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked in the staff could not do enough for us. They were very friendly. The hotel room was also lovely, very French. We had the bigger room 20m2 which I would recommend as I would not of liked to have been in a smaller room than the one we had. The windows were double glazed so the noise was not a problem. We were close to restaurants shops and the metro system which made it very easy to get around. We were there for three nights and loved every minute of the lovely staff, hotel and of course Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place for us.”
Reviews.Author: YNV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel le Regent for 6 nights with my twelve year old daughter. The Left Bank location couldn't be better: an easy walk to many tourist sites, restaurants, cafes and a market. The one-way rue Dauphine leads straight down to the Pont Neuf. The hotel is around the corner from the Odeon metro and near the St Michel-Notre Dame station. We stayed in room 51, a "superior deluxe room" which was very spacious for a small Paris hotel. We peeked in at a regular double room on our floor and it was substantially smaller. Our double bed consisted of two narrow singles pushed together, but since we are not large, this was just fine for us. Our room was on the fifth floor bright, pretty and comfortable, with several tall windows looking overlooking the Rue Dauphine. If street noise bothers you, bring earplugs. The evening noise is the price you pay for being in the middle of a busy neighborhood off the Blvd. St. Germaine with many cafes and for the street view. We had a large modern bathroom with a deep bathtub and sunshine yellow tiles, and a towel warmer. There is an elevator just big enough for two people and their luggage. There is a breakfast room in the basement which we did not patronize, since it seemed unexceptional and there were dozens of cafes nearby. What distinguishes this litttle hotel from all the other similar three star hotels around it is the wonderful staff. Every one of the concierges was friendly and helpful to a fault. They made suggestions and bookings for us, and lent us umbrellas. They seemed genuinely happy to see us and interested in what we had been doing. The manager was especially helpful. On our last night, around 9 pm, I realized that I was going to need an additional suitcase to get my things home. We were leaving first thing in the morning and all the stores in the neighborhood closed by 8. The manager insisted that I take his own bag and wouldn't hear of me paying him for it. As it turned out, I was able to manage without the additional bag, but I thought this kind gesture spoke volumes about the exemplary service at the Hotel Le Regent. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice when in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Wooders1
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this hotel is all about location. It's right in the centre of the action in St Germain de Pres, just steps from dozens of great bars, restaurants and cafes and a short walk to the Seine, the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay and transport. We had a standard room, which although it was very small, it was also very quiet as it was located at the rear of the hotel and away from the street. You would never have known there were any other guests (and the hotel was full), much less one of Paris' most lively street's just outside. The staff were really friendly and very helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel in the future and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mypinkparis
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Paris. I've stayed there more than once and have even brought friends from the states to stay there. I have always gotten the upgraded superior rooms and they have been quite large. The yellow room in the front is very roomy and Parisian. You really get what you pay for in this area. You can't expect the Taj Mahal when you want to pay for the cheapest room. This is hands down the best area in Paris in my opinion. Right next to the Odeon metro and tons of shopping, cafes, Seine, Notre Dame in walking distance. J'aime Paris et le Le' RÃ©gent.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Donna_G71
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall is a nice hotel, but I was so disappointed with my room (a standard). The bed took up almost all of the room. It really was just too small for comfort - as other reviewers have pointed out, there was hardly any room for a suitcase. Opening the closet door was a challenge! It was prettily decorated but seemed just slightly frayed around the edges. Worst of all, it was not what the hotel had led me to expect - in email correspondence they had specified a room overlooking a courtyard, which this definitely was not. So something went wrong somewhere. I got a glimpse of a much more spacious and attractive room down the corridor - another world from mine. IBut 'm giving this hotel three stars rather than two because there were some positives. I actually liked the bathroom - although small, there were some really big storage shelves, funky tiles and a big shower. The staff were friendly and helpful. It's also situated in a very central, convenient neighbourhood with everything I needed - cafes, supermarket, drycleaners, even a fruit shop. I also didn't need to eat breakfast in the hotel - for half the price or less you can just go round the corner to cafe Paul (in rue de Seine, nice breakfast and staff, quaint decor).

Reviews.Title: “Hated this place”
Reviews.Author: nanny2six
Reviews.Content: After an extensive stay in Europe and after a wonderful hotel experience in Vienna we were extremely dissapointed with this hotel. I had asked to be upgraded to a larger room but because of our delayed arrival did not happen although we could have changed on the 2nd night. The room was drab, hair on the blanket, extremely small ( we had to store our luggage downstairs). Breakfast was very expensive, no one to help with bags which was a chore as the elevator was a small triangular shaped space that allowed for 1 person and 2 bags (only if the other person handed them to you.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: z_riddlecr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for the price. Most Parisian hotels tend to be a little pricey, and you pay for your location. We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of sept and enjoyed ourselves. The rooms are tiny - the bed took up the entire room! The bathroom was very nice and everything was very clean. The staff were overall friendly and helpful. The hotel is in walking distance to many of the major attractions and there is a subway location very close by for the places further away. Overall, this hotel is worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for just sleeping.”
Reviews.Author: balletgirl03
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Le Regent was a nice hotel. The lobby was small but had a nice sitting area that we used frequently. The staff was very polite but we didn't really engage with them much. The elevator was really small. It says it holds 4 people (sans luggage) but we could only really get 3 in. We just hoped the elevator wouldn't jam. Our room was on the 3rd floor so I mostly took the winding stairs. Be careful because the steps are very narrow. The rooms are VERY small. Our double bed basically took up the entire room. But if you only plan on sleeping there, it is nice. The bed was okay. For all you Americans - the room was very clean! The bathroom was small. The shower was actually a nice size. Forget using the hairdryer - not enough power to even dry your hair. We booked our room directly from the website and had no problems. Remember to have your bill figured in EUROs and not converted to US Dollars or you will basically pay the conversion rate twice. The location was great. Very close to the Seine. Very close to many metro stops. I'd recommend this hotel if you were looking for a nice place to sleep after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location but could do better in some areas”
Reviews.Author: Giddy-boy
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have said, this is a reasonable hotel in a charming building and central location, with excellent cafes and restaurants nearby The rooms are comfortable and well equipped, if slightly shabby around the edges, and the front ones, at least, are fairly spacious by Paris standards, with plenty of hanging room. The bathroom was also a good size and nicely appointed. As other reviews have said, breakfast is a bit expensive but so are St Germain cafes and it was very useful to be able to have it in the room until quite late. A few caveats, however. For a short midweek stay for our 25th wedding anniversary (we honeymooned in the area), we booked a superior deluxe room on-line, paying 238 euros plus booking fee for the first night in advance. Knowing how busy the Rue de Buci in particular can be, we also requested a top-floor room, if possible, On arrival at 2.30pm, with the hotel almost empty, the extremely sullen chap on reception waved away our booking confirmation and ignored us when we told him what we had booked and pre-paid for. The room he gave us on the fourth floor was, it later transpired, a deluxe, a grade down from that we had paid-for. It was comfortable enough but we had wanted the best as it was such a special occasion. In the end we were only charged 220 euros for the lesser room (and the difference at least covered our breakfast costs) but no apology was made when we pointed it out on check-out - in fact it seemed to be our fault for noticing. And heaven forbid that anyone might offer to refund our booking fee. Secondly, despite assurances from other guests here, we also found our front room very noisy at night; the Tartan Army of Scots football supporters were in town for a match with France and, even with all the windows closed, we were kept awake until the early hours by shouts in the square below so dread to think what it might be like on a summer Saturday night. All in all, we had a lovely romantic trip but for the reasons above would probably stay elsewhere another time.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Base For Paris”
Reviews.Author: jbk1
Reviews.Content: Just as it says on the tin and as per most of the other reviews about the hotel on this site. A perfect little, reasonably priced, hotel with a great location in central Paris. Rooms were clean, though small, stayed in a standard room at 136 euro with the summer discount. Pleasant and helpful on reception, would happily visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sungirlxxxx
Reviews.Content: Satyed 4 nights. 2 Rooms , one Superior ( 190 euros)one Deluxe(176 euros). Not much difference in size , or decor . Both on 5th floor overlooking Rue Dauphine. Breakfast not incl, extra 14 euros pp. Rather walk 1 minute up to Paul and pay 7 euros for the same thing. Checkin : smooth Elevator the smallest I have ever seen but it works. Decor: pretty, cheerful. Decent size for Europe. Bathrooms well appointed except for ridiculous haidryer, that has to be held vertically at alltimes else it goes off, so its useless. Beds not comfy and pillows too soft. Location: Excellent, close to Seine and Batobus, walkable to Louvre, Notre Dame, Marais. Many restaurants nearby, Close to laduree on Rue Bonaparte and Relais d l entrecote on Rue Benoit. Close to metro on Bvld. St. Germain. Service; polite informative from day staff. After 8pm the guys are not as knowledgeable about the city or it could have just been a language issue. The older guy forgot our 6am wakeup calls to both rooms on checkout day and it was just pure luck that I got up at 6.22 and noticed the time so that could have been disastrous as cab was picking us up at 7.15am so it was quite a rush. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful home base”
Reviews.Author: mokuleiagirl
Reviews.Content: This lovely small hotel is a perfect base from which to explore the lovely Saint Germain des Pres neighborhood. Right out your doorstep are cafes, crepe stands, lunch spots, bakeries, and lots of great art galleries. Just a few blocks walk will get you right to the banks of the Seine where you can pick up a river ferry, see Notre Dame, and begin your exploration of the city's major sights. Also, 2 metro stops are within just a few blocks, making it easy to get from here to the Airport and all over the city. We stayed in a room on the top floor with beautiful yellow decor that brightened even the gray Paris days. The room was quiet and comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious - all very clean. The French decor was much appreciated - it really made us feel like we were in Paris! There were 3 windows in the room, all of which opened to let in the fresh air and great views of the street below. We weren't bothered at all by the street noise. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. All in all - a great and affordable place to stay in Paris where you'll get good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & view- psycho staff- small rooms”
Reviews.Author: SeattleDietcoke
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for six nights in July. The positive things about the hotel are that it is air-conditioned, there was a nice view of the Ille de Cite from our room, and the location allows you to walk out the door and be on the Pont Neuf or Odeon train stop in a matter of blocks. The main draw back is the size of the establishment. Our room was like a closet and the bathroom like a car trunk in terms of size but it is well lit which helps during the day. The hair dryer looks like a vacuum and is less utile than walking briskly and air drying your hair! The elevator is stunningly small and I have never been on an elevator that takes so long to ascend and descend six floors. The man at the front desk was rather unhelpful at check-in and the man working the overnights was very rude and on a severe power trip concerning our room key. If you merely plan on sleeping in the room this is a great place but if you plan on relaxing in your room a lot this might not be the most ideal spot. Bring your own hair-dryer if you require one. Also, the room didn't have a clock and I would suggest bringing hangers so that you can hang clothing and put your suitcase out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great the second time too”
Reviews.Author: luveurope
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Regent. The positive reviews here are all correct. I consider the Regent to be one of the best 3*'s for your euro in St Germain des Pres. You can't beat the location. You really can't beat the price. The staff is very friendly and some of them even remembered me from my previous stay two years prior. All in all a lovely place! Bottom line: I've now spent a total of 18 nights in the Regent and I don't even have one complaint!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MJSKentucky
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. We were celebrating our 35th anniversary and were given a beautiful room with a very modern bathroom. We love the location of this hotel and the friendly staff. The young lady at the front desk was most helpful in obtaining a shuttle for us the morning we left for the airport. Earlier ice was sent to the room for my injured (broken)hand. The hotel is very charming and clean. The staff goes above and beyond and is always friendly and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cgd284
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an area full of energy, restaurants and cafes. Its very close to Notre Dame and the Louvre, as well as the Metro to other Paris detinations. The rooms are on the small size like all Paris hotels but the bathroom is updated and surprisingly large. WIFI internet access is available for 5 Euros per hour. I have spent a few weekends at the le Regent and its a great place to use as a base for sightseeing and just enjoying the atmosphere of Paris

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel le Regent”
Reviews.Author: gogo66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first vacation alone (post kids) last August for our 15th anniversary. The hotel was exactly what we were looking for. The rooms were very quaint. We loved the floor to ceiling windows overlooking the street . The bathroom was large for such a reasonable hotel in Europe. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We felt like it was our Paris home away from home. We did have a little noise one night from someone in the street, but that was it. We loved the neighborhood, the shops, the cafe's. I would highly recommend this for someone looking for an intimate hotel and not a 5 star. We will stay here again! Hopefully soon! Also, I highly reccomend fat tire bicycle tour to Versailles. Also, had our anniversary dinner at Bofinger. The food was wonderful and the service was the best we had in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Top Buzz”
Reviews.Author: airylegend
Reviews.Content: i loved the close proximity to odeon and st michel and could see notre dame, st germain and pantheon close to hotel from our floor of hotel. nice bakery called cartan and ice cream shop on rue buci and conveniance store a bit further down. staff answered all my requests perfectly. best meal was at l'ardoise on rue mont thabor near pl vendome but got a nice kebab on rue moufatard near pantheon from turkish shop.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Le Regent - C'est Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: JP8
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Le Regent for 4 nights during the Easter long weekend. The staff were extremely friendly and they were comfortable conversing in English. The room was quaint and had a great French motif with a colourful bathroom and floral wallpaper and curtains which were charming. The location was excellent and in the heart of the St. Germain district amid several cafes and a popular gelato shop which was never short of people. The hotel was also close to the Metro stations Odeon (2 minute walk) and St. Michel (5 minute walk) which made it convenient. It is also within walking distance of Pont Neuf (5 minutes), Notre Dame (10 minutes), the Louvre (15 minutes). It was a great hotel and I would not hesitate to stay here again next time I am in Paris. If within your budget, book the larger rooms which are facing Rue du Dauphine. These have a great french balcony and great for watching Paris pass infront of your eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BJL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at HÃ´tel Le RÃ©gent, 61 rue Dauphine, 75006 the first week of February 2007 Overall the area is a very busy one with lots of art galleries, shops and restaurants. The hotel was close to the Odeon Metro stop that was well connected for most everywhere I wanted to go. It is also very centrally located for walking just about anywhere. There is also a Champion grocery marche located just a block over. I had room #24 on the 2nd floor that faced the courtyard (I use that term loosely). I heard no street noise whatsoever. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was traveling solo and booked a standard room for one person. This was my 5th trip to Paris and umpteenth to Europe, so I expected a small room -- and it was indeed VERY small. I am not a large person but I was still bumping into just about everything. I was able to store my smaller carry on in the ample closet and probably could have squeezed my larger case in as well if I'd put one inside the other and pushed the clothes together. Didn't think of it ::shrug:: It was clean, everything was in good shape and had almost everything I needed and wasn't bad enough I felt the need to change hotels or request an upgrade to the Deluxe room which was 50 Euro more per night. If my husband had been with me, we'd have needed to upgrade to a larger room. For the first time I did not pack a travel clock because it seems that every room I've ever stayed in has had a clock - except this one. The wake up call feature on the phone didn't seem to work, but the desk was happy enough to set one for me each evening. The only stations in English on the TV were MSNBC Europe which was all financial news all the time and two different BBC channels, one of which the sound was so bad you could barely understand it. So if TV is important to you...not much in that way. There was a mini bar fridge in the room that contained a couple sodas and water for 3,50 Euro each. I used it to store my nightcap wine. The bathroom, while so small you had to sit sideways on the toilet, seemed brand new and featured a good sized shower stall that had glass doors. The biggest problem with the shower (which had great water pressure and fairly regulated temperature) was that it was about a 12" step to get in - which isn't such a big deal until you're wet and need to step out - but again, the bathroom was so small you could put your hand on the door jam and the other on the sink for support. The other problem for me in the bathroom was that the hair dryer was located next to the toilet, so to use it you had to stand in the tiny space between the toilet and the wall. I rapped my elbows on not only the tissue dispenser, but the heated towel rack (that didn't work). Might not be an issue if your hair is short and you don't need much interaction between dryer and brush. The best thing about the room for me was that the bed was very comfortable - not too soft and not too hard - seems like every hotel I've stayed in in Europe has felt like sleeping on the box springs. There is an more expensive hotel down the street called Hotel d'Aubusson that has a lovely bar with a jazz band that plays on Friday & Saturday nights. It is on the corner of rue Dauphine and rue Christine. On rue Christine, there is a great little restaurant called Chez Fernand. I might stay there again, but go for a larger room. But I do enjoy staying at a different hotel in a different area each time i visit.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Immersion!”
Reviews.Author: John_Z_MN
Reviews.Content: We got lucky a couple years ago and found a small hotel in Rome in the middle of a bustling neighborhood near Campo de Fiori. When looking for a Paris hotel we were hoping to come close to that same sort of experience. We were once again very lucky. When you walk out the front door of Le Regent you know you are in Paris and the sights, sounds and smells are unmistakable. Turn right and three short blocks later you are looking across the Seine at the Louvre. Turn left and within a block you are in the midst of the St. Germain des Pres boulevard scene. Straight ahead is the very active le Buci. Obviously we were very pleased with the location. We took the train from CDG for a few Euros to the St. Michel staiton and walked the last couple blocks to the hotel. St. Michel also gets you on the RER to Versailles. For the rest of our poking around the city we used the very handy Odeon Metro station. Walking to Notre Dame was very pleasant, and a long leisurely walk back from the Eiffel Tower was doable. St. Sulpice, the Luxembourg Gardens, the D'Orsay and Louvre are all nearby. The area is very active with restaurants and bars galore and a sprinkling of retailers of all descriptions, grocery stores, bakeries, and ice cream shops mixed in. The venerable Jacques Cagna restaurant is within a couple blocks on Rue des Grands Augustins for an easy relaxed Michelin starred experience. In spite of the beat of the area the room windows (which appear to be relatively new) keep out all but the loudest street noises. We had a superior deluxe room overlooking Rue Dauphine, and while a little small, it offered everything we needed including a very upscale en-suite bathroom. The multi-lingual staff was especially accommodating and always greeted us with a smile and words of encouragement and advice. We used them for restaurant recommendations and reservations as well as transportation requirements. We would have given the hotel a "5" but the carpet in the room was due for replacement and we would have enjoyed a few more square feet. Everything but the carpet was perfectly clean. We got a peek at the smaller rooms and they would not have been acceptable for us so the few extra euros was worth it. With all of the action outside (even a Starbucks up the street) we did not bother with the 14E breakfast at the hotel but rather grabbed some local pastries in the morning. The Le Regent was definitely not the George V, but it was exactly what we were looking for. We couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Third time at Le Regent, Paris”
Reviews.Author: wanado7
Reviews.Content: Great staff very friendly good English speaking and always helpful, beautiful room, perfect location subway is around the corner but it is the right location for walking almost to anywhere of interest in Paris. This was our third time us and our friends from Chicago. For a slight rate incrrease we upgraded to a superior room though the standard rooms from our previous stays were good this was much larger and more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique”
Reviews.Author: EMTBStation53
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights in October and have stayed in the hotel several times in the past. It continues to be a great hotel for the price. The location is perfect, and the addition of an elevator that goes from the rez-de-chaussee is a real plus. The people at the front desk are especially helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but too small”
Reviews.Author: J.Domenech
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the staff is very friendly, but room 33 is too small for its price. From the other reviews I read I conclude mine was the smallest room in the hotel, which had barely space enough for a double bed. The bathroom was reasonable, modern and clean, but the drain in the shower was partially clogged. Actually, the one weak spot in all French hotels is their plumbing. Anyway, in the past I stayed in bigger rooms in the same area for what I paid at Le Regent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: socaljsb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel le Regent for 2 nights on the beginning of our 2.5 week trek across Western Europe. This boutique hotel, set right in the heart of the Saint Germain district, is conveniently located between two metro stops (Odeon and St Germain) and is within walking distance of most of the major sites in Paris, including the Louvre and the Champs Elysee. We arrived in Paris in the early morning and made our way to the hotel via metro. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted and were able to leave our bags until the room was ready in the afternoon. The standard room we reserved was spacious enough for the two of us and had great windows opening out to rue Dauphine. The bathroom had a mixed shower/bath stall and toilet was out of the way, separated by a wall at the end of the sink and counter. We never had breakfast at the hotel, being that there are a number of cafes to choose from when walking to the day's destination. Overall, the Hotel le Regent can't be beat in terms of location, price, and charm. The staff was wonderful and the accomodations were quite comfortable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel, Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: travelerfromsj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in early September. First of all, this hotel is perfectly situated for seeing Paris. It's in the Latin Quarter, about a 5 minute walk from the Seine river, and a minute's walk from Metro stop Odeon. There are countless dining options within a 10-minute walk- heck, we could see two cafÃ©s just by leaning out the window; plus there's an ATM right outside the hotel door. At night the area outside was busy with late-night strollers and diners, but it felt very safe walking around this area at night, and it was very quiet inside the room once the windows were closed. We booked a "superior deluxe" room on the hotel web site, which turned out to be a spacious and elegant room on the 5th floor decorated in mustard yellow. The hotel is in an older building that has been renovated- the floor for some reason was slightly tilted. The room had 2 single beds, A/C, a safe, lots of closet and shelf space, and a minibar (with no alcohol, sadly, but there are lots of stores nearby). Great tile bathroom with a tub/shower combo, toiletries, hair dryer, and a heated towel rack. The staff was extremely pleasant and friendly. One minor inconvenience is that you must hand in your room key when leaving the hotel, but they were always quick to give it back to us when we came back in. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “prefect location”
Reviews.Author: cpts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed at Le Regent to celebrate our respective 25th anniversaries. We wanted a hotel that provided a great location with everything on our doorstep since we were only there for 4 days and Le Regent ticked all the boxes. We didn't bother with breakfast in the hotel as the cafe directly opposite was cheaper and the food good. The air con in our rooms was excellent which was very welcome in the height of summer. We both had delux rooms facing onto the street. The double glazing meant a quiet night's sleep and the rooms had ample space for the length of our stay. The bathrooms were particularly luxurious. On checking out we were delighted to find that we had reduction for the 4th night which made the hotel really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - but felt ripped off”
Reviews.Author: Hugh(_!_)Janus
Reviews.Content: Reading all the reveiws below me, I may seem a little stingy with my reveiw - but I'm being honest about how I felt here. I booked the best room they had (a Superior Deluxe) they also had standard and deluxe. The cost was 225 euro per night. (I got room 12). Reading the descriptions outside the hotel of each room type - it said that the Superiors had twin beds (we had a double) and were larger than the other rooms. Ours was pretty tiny. I did ask at reception about this, and they said "there are exceptions!" Staff Ok - nice & friendly. Breakfast - expensive @14Euro for a bit of bread and a coffee, Rooms clean & tidy. It is true that the double glazing at the front keeps the noise of the street out, but nothing can stop the noise of an American Woman chatting in the corridor at 8AM coming into your room. Do Americans have volume control ? Overall, it was OK but overpriced. Ibis bercy for me next time

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I celebrated my 50th birthday in Paris (without our husbands) and wanted to experience both the Right and Left Banks, so we split our hotel stays between the two and chose Hotel Le Regent based on the reviews from TripAdvisor. The accommodations and staff at Hotel Le Regent were beyond reproach. The colour scheme in the first room did not suit our taste, so we were offered another room with colours that we found more soothing. With only 25 rooms in the entire hotel, we were lucky to have a choice and the hotel staff was very accommodating. The elevator to the ground floor renovation was completed during our 2nd or 3rd day, and this certainly made life easier. My sister's arthritic knees were especially grateful as we were assured this work would be completed prior to our arrival. Our superior room was larger than a regular one and provided us adequate space (given European standards). The superior deluxe room (already occupied) provides even more space and a marble bathroom, but our needs were more than met. The staff was very helpful when we accidentally blew a fuse when attempting to use our own hairdryer with a converter that could not handle the wattage. There is no shortage of restaurants and places to buy food in the area. We sampled the French strawberries that we bought at a big nearby outdoor market on Buci street. They were a bit more expensive than the imports but quite delicious! Given our proximity to Pont Neuf, we were able to do a lot of sightseeing and easily return to Angelina's for their famous Mont Blanc pastries. We saw the lights of Paris from the sightseeing boats at Pont Neuf on our last night, and I would highly recommend this one-hour tour as the Tour Eiffel is especially beautiful from this vantage point. I could go on and on. The Hotel Le Regent was a great base for our adventures and I would recommend it to anyone staying on the Left Bank.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good 3* hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was a pleasent surprise, larger than expected and pretty. We were on the 5th floor and faced the street, we were worried about noise when we first arrived. But I am happy to report that was not a problem The location was excellent for site seeing, shopping and resurants. I am looking forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: drdanmay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location, just down the street and across the bridge (pont neuf) from the Louve. The staff vere very helpful and friendly. The lift is pretty sorry (like many we encountered in Europe), and the stairs are very shallow, so don't try to bring a big suitcase! The rooms were tastefully decorated, and very well cleaned and maintained. For the price we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SamG2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, and I would certainly go back. We stayed in a standard room, which is small, but comfortable with everything you need. The bathroom was bright and cheerful, with a great shower. And the air con worked - so much that I actually had to get up in the night to turn it off as I was cold! The location is ideal. Just steps away from numerous bars, cafe's and restaurants. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, small Parisien hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Iregeo
Reviews.Content: What a sweet little property! I stayed for 6 nights in a deluxe room on the second floor (room 22). It was attractively decorated and spotlessly clean, with a yellow floral print bedcover and matching floor to (high) ceiling curtains. The bed, linens and pillows were all quite comfortable, and the adequately sized room (I was traveling alone) also contained a small writing desk, two chairs, a small table, two nightstands, an armoir, a t.v., a minibar, and plenty of adjustable lighting. Have I mentioned the outstanding, separately controlled air-conditioning? The bathroom was large, all of marble and very well equipped. It had a tub/shower with a half shower door, a hair dryer, lighted make-up mirror, towel warmer, and plenty of storage area. The towels were thick and smelled sweet. The hotel also provides thick terry robes for use during your stay. The area is bustling, in the heart of St. Germain. The hotel is at the crossroads of rue Dauphine, rue Mazarine and rue San Andre des Artes, with cafes, shops, restaurants and tourist attractions either right outside your door or a stone's throw away. Perhaps the nicest thing about staying here is the warm and friendly staff. Fluent in many languages, the front desk staff always greets you with a smile and some friendly conversation. They are in no way intrusive, but very obviously eager to please and provide individual attention. This one's a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharmy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Le Regent for 5 nights in July. We have absolutely no complaints of the hotel except that it's a pain to carry your suitcases up one flight to where the elevator is - but from what I understand they will be renovating later this year to include an elevator from the lobby. That being said we felt the hotel offered everything we needed. The staff was always friendly and helpful and our rooms were clean and comfortable. A definate plus was the air conditioning! Our room was small, but we expected that (the hotel does have larger rooms). There is really no room for suitcases, but a large armoire allowed us to unpack all of our clothing for the week. Our room was on the 1st floor and faced the back of the building and was very quiet despite the busy St. Germain area. The St. Germain area was a great location - a few blocks from several metro station, a short walk to Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter, the Louvre, Luxembourg Gardens and more. I would definately recommend to other visitors and I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: google
Reviews.Content: Great location. Everything right outside door and close to 3 metro stops. Room small but we knew that as it was last one left. We tried to upgrade but they were full. Room clean as was bathroom with lots of hot water. Staff very friendly and helpful especially Elias aka Bruce willis!!! Good restaurant recommendations. Close to Latin quarter which is also hopping. did not do breakfast as better places right outside you door. Rooms in back are very quiet. Would stay there agin in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Location Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Much2Learn
Reviews.Content: Our room was tiny (#16 at the top of the main stairway), but it was amazingly quiet and the location couldn't have been better. We walked right out the door of the hotel into the heart of Saint Germain. We paid 140 euros per night and thought that was very fair.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect--right in the middle of St-Germain, and our superior class room was quite spacious and very clean. Bathroom was great. Soundproof windows effectively kept out the street noise. Desk staff was very helpful, answering questions and making reservations. Great value for the money in my opinion!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 6 nights at the end of April, 2005. We had room 15, which was a little small, but clean and located on the 1st floor (one flight up). It served its purpose, being that we weren't really in the room for long periods of time. The staff was very helpful: Sandrine and Ilias (sp?). They were nice enough to help us with car reservations, and also gave us a plug converters to use while we were there. There was also free wifi connection, so bring your laptop if you can't get away from the internet! It was centrally located, with a wondeful variety of shops, creperies, markets, bakeries, and restaurants. The metro was 1 1/2 blocks away, but we did not even bother taking it. We ended up walking everywhere. The Louvre and Notre Dame was 15 minutes away. Musee D'Orsay was a little bit of a longer walk, but it's a nice walk along the Seine. Jardin du Luxombourg is also a very close walk, as is the Latin quarter, which is happening in the late hours, with many creperies, falafel and gyro stands. It has a great vibe and you can eat on a bench in front of a lit and beautiful Notre Dame. I would definitely consider staying there again. It was a great location, as well as very pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “le regent -beware”
Reviews.Author: finesilver
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times before ,made a reservation for 5 nights but left today after one night, there was a stain of some sort on the carpet that had to be cleaned today, so they first offered us the choice to move rooms tomorrow, then called back and said that we had to move today and that the carpet repairmen would be there in 30 minutes and that there "might" be some smell. the other room they proposed was not nearly as nice and it was kind of take it or leave it. while we were asking the woman at the desk about this the manager of the hotel came down and started yelling at the desk clerk right in front of us, my french is not great but I understand enough that she was calling us "dumb stubborn" americans to the clerk, it was most inappropriate. the manager then stormed off. we immediately went upstairs and packed and found another hotel down the street. I travel alot all over the world and have never had an experience like this, as totally unprofessional as ever; if there was a problem with the room why did they let us stay there even one night. I scratch this one off the list for good. your mileage may vary, wish mine had. caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Hotel le Regent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel le Regent is a fine location for the Left Bank...right in the middle of le Buci, and a block away from the Metro stop Odeon. The larger rooms overlooking the street are terrific...nicely decorated, with grat baths. Staff helpful and pleasant. Only complaint is the walk to the first floor, where the elevator begins. The price is fine for the room and location.

Reviews.Title: “A great location, a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jdblakesle
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel le Regent after our long flight from Atlanta, at 10 a.m.! Too early to check in, but the sweet gal at the reception desk took our bags and told us to check back around 1 p.m. Upon our return, our room on the 4th floor was ready. The elevator (lift) is small and I'm horribly claustrophobic, so we opted to climb the stairs. The bellman brought our bags up to our room. There were two twin beds, pushed together to make a king bed. The bathroom was small, but separated into a "potty room" and the lavatory and tub/shower area. It was spotless, fresh, had obviously been updated recently. Our two windows looked out on Rue Dauphine, with window boxes of red geraniums in each. The room was small, but very efficiently arranged. We never had breakfast in the hotel, as there are numerous cafes in walking distance. We loved this hotel, except for one thing. It was so noisy during the late night hours! From 11 p.m. until the wee hours of the morning, there was activity going on in the streets below. If I went again, I'd ask for a room away from the street. We loved the view, but the noise was a minus...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: prink_123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at le Regent in mid-September and loved it. Our two rooms facing the street were roomy and light by Left Bank standards, with 12-ft. ceilings and French doors. When open, the doors allowed us to enjoy the sounds of the bustling neighborhood. Closed, the doors kept the room quiet enough for a good night's sleep. The location is superb for walking to most major tourist sites, and there are countless wonderful cafes, restaurants and boutiques nearby. Angelique and Sandrine at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A St Germain des Pres address for 200 euros, although the rooms are quite small and the elevator starts one floor up - requiring schlepping luggage up one flight of narrow, winding stairs. We reserved a room overlooking Rue Dauphine, but when we arrived, were assigned room 1, a tiny room off the lobby with a courtyard view. That meant it looked onto an area of pavers and a potted plant at the bottom of an airshaft/area between buildings. It was resolved with a bit of compromise on our part, and a great deal of charm on theirs. We loved the room we finally got. Excellent staff. Great location. You will love waking up in this nighborhood.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Le Regent
HotelInfo.Address: 61 rue Dauphine, 75006 Paris, France
